intro: Tithymalus nudiflorus, commonly known as the nakedflower tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear before the leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Tithymalus nudiflorus is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
